subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Nathan re: Hoax
author: bruce halliday
full_text:

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Nathan, 
 
I suggest you read the headline and description of this group.
=
We are a group of real time communication researchers that are 
continously=
 seeking the truth. The founder of this board 
Mr. Frank Sumption has alway=
's made it clear that It is not a place 
for sceptics and they will not be =
tolerated. We are here to study and 
further real time soirit communication=
, not have to defend every post 
we make or file we add. I suggest you take=
 your negative accusations and 
detrimental unfounded criticism and sceptic=
ism somewhere else. 
 
You are wearing your welcome thin here, not to menti=
on within 5 posts 
you have contradicted yourself three times. and went fro=
m the philosophy 
of aliens enslaving human spirits to questioning any chan=
ce that this method 
of spirit communication could or does exist and is a c=
onspiricy to fool unsuspecting
people like us by means of a super transmitt=
er.
 
I have learned by experience to try and keep this type of post civil,=
 So for any moderators that are reading this 
Please review the situation.
=
 
Bruce Halliday
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: f1crack=
er75@...: Sat, 12 Apr 2008 19:24:11 -0700Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] R=
e:First SuCcessful Recordings - Nathan re: Hoax





Nathan, I am amazed yo=
u would suggest or even think that!  I live in Cary, North Carolina and rec=
ord when I have the time. There is no set schedule, and when I turn my radi=
o on and someone says hello Michael, or even shouts out "Mike Edwards", or =
a spirit tells me I am holding a carving in my hand, who would even know I =
turned the radio on? Only my wife knows I record, and we have kept this res=
earch from our children as well as our neighbors. So you are suggesting tha=
t Margaret, lets say who lives where I do not know, is playing a joke on me=
 with a high tech two way radio?
 
itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@...> wr=
ote:


Hi Nathan. I always look to relevance as a key in determining whethe=
r or not something is appropriate to the session. If this were a hoax, I wo=
uld then have to seek an explanation for how private information is known b=
y the 'hoax perp', particularly information that would require visual aware=
ness. Some of us have examples of appropriate responses being given when as=
king things like, "Can you name something nearby me?" or "Please tell me wh=
at I'm holding in my left hand." A sophisticated multi-transmission two way=
 radio would not explain answers which require 'visual' information of some=
 kind (though I'll be the first to admit my understanding of electronics is=
 limited but I'm fairly confident on this aspect.) Of course, there is alwa=
ys the chance that the person running the hoax is also, or in partnership w=
ith, an extremely talented remote viewer or psychic who is able to glean th=
at visual information from the ether or the mind of the experimenter. And w=
hat of those examples where people have confirmed the sound of the voice be=
ing "just like" that of their loved one in spirit? Surely the hoaxer isn't =
also able to mimic people's loved ones.If you are using EVP Maker with anyt=
hing other than the allophones file, which contains no words to begin with,=
 you are also running the possibility of 'false positives' albeit they woul=
dn't be from a hoax. Again, I look to relevance to be key, and relevant inf=
o that would not come easily to a stranger is even better. For example, I t=
urned on my MiniBox for the very first time and said, "Hello?" and immediat=
ely received the response, "Hello Margaret." If this were a hoax, how could=
 that person know in less than 10 seconds, who I was by name. I had not giv=
en this information out. Not to mention that you have people experimenting =
24/7 and receiving similar responses. How in the world could an organizatio=
n have the manpower, technology, or even the desire, to attempt such a hoax=
? I mean that as a genuine inquiry, because there might be an explanation I=
 have not thought of. I have one example where, via radio sweep, my communi=
cator was able to correctly identify the status and location of a missing p=
erson (who it turns out was alive and well, so we ended up with confirmatio=
n that the info given had indeed been correct - which is much less complica=
ted that trying to track and understand the clues when associated with the =
dead, or missing but not found.) Again, if a hoax, would that have simply b=
een a lucky guess on the part of the hoaxer?Bottom line for me is ... have =
I wondered if it could be a hoax? Or simply a fortuitous tuning of the dial=
? Yes, on both accounts. But there is enough compelling evidence to rule ou=
t both of them as an explanation for the far too many relevant examples rec=
eived by so many of us.Good food for thought, but after digesting it, I'd h=
ave to say, "No, a sophisticated hoax does not sufficiently explain the phe=
nomena on a large scale."Margaret--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Nathan Sha=
rman <v1230mail@...> wrote:>> Has it ever occurred to you, that some one or=
> organisation, could be using a radio to say the things> you heard?> > Thi=
s whole radio and spirit voices, could be a MASSIVE> HOAX, perpetuated by s=
ome one with a sophisticated> multi-transmission two way radio.> > Think ab=
out it.> > THAT IS WHY I USE EVPmaker only to commuincate with> the other d=
imension.> > __________________________________________________> Do You Yah=
oo!?> Tired of spam? Yahoo! Mail has the best spam protection around > http=
://mail.yahoo.com>Michael Edwards: Cary, North Carolina. f1cracker75@yahoo.=
com
